other_tests.findings: Ulcerated lesion (0.8 cm by 0.5 cm) diagnosed as a compound type, traumatized Spitz nevus. The lesion extended to the lateral border of the specimen.
Severely atypical, recurrent, multifocal, epithelioid-cell melanocytic proliferation, with features consistent with melanoma.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Original lesion was initially diagnosed as a compound type, traumatized Spitz nevus.

other_tests.findings: Two out of three sentinel lymph nodes were positive for metastatic melanoma.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The patient underwent wide local excision followed by sentinel lymph node biopsy; no evidence of melanoma in the complete lymph node dissection (37 nodes).
